page.title: 15Fewer School Children
page.content: In September we are losing a teacher and we shall have only 3 classes with 75 children on roll. Our Headmaster says that 12 years ago there were 270 children in the school and 8 classes. The reason our numbers have gone down is mainly because the prison officers do not have to live in Princetown now but can live in Tavistock, Yelveron or other places and travel to work. The Home Office is only retaining a small number of quarters and is in process of handing back the majority to the Duchy.The Duchy, in turn is handing some to the local council. Our Headmaster and other people in the village are concerned about it because there have been so many empty houses for so long. The population of the village has decreased from about 1000 to 800 and the nature of the village has changed in recent years.
